qas.question: What language does the ECB generally use?
When in communication with other nationalities, what language is generally used?
What language is the ECB website run in?
How are the languages of official documents handled?

answers.text: the official languages of the EU

qas.question: What language does the ECB generally forbid?
When in communication with other nationalities, what language is never used?
What language is the ECB website banned in?

plausible_answers.text: the official languages of the EU

qas.question: How are the languages of official documents avoided?

context: The internal working language of the ECB is generally <a0_0><b4_0>English<b4_0/><a0_0/>, and press conferences are usually held in English. External communications are handled flexibly: English is preferred (though not exclusively) for communication within the ESCB (i.e. with other central banks) and with financial markets; communication with other national bodies and with EU citizens is <a1_0><b5_0>normally in their respective language<b5_0/><a1_0/>, but the ECB website is predominantly <a2_0><b6_0>English<b6_0/><a2_0/>; official documents such as the Annual Report are in <a3_0><b7_0>the official languages of the EU<b7_0/><a3_0/>.
